case.name: Tojiko Appears
case.description: The Crown Prince's ghost consort has appeared out of hiding to take Miko's cape away.

case.name: Tojiko Tandem
case.description: The Crown Prince's ghost consort has appeared out of hiding to fuck her.

case.name: Spellcard Attack
case.description: Miko has unleashed a powerful Special Attack, Human Sign "Tradition of Just Rewards," against Saki.

case.name: True Desires (Prompt Marker)
case.description: Miko asks the table what their deepest desire is (she already knows, of course, so be honest!).

notes.note: The joke here is Miko can't understand Gloria through her thick accent and assumes it's a problem with Gloria.
This is a good opportunity for Kaz to talk about Magistocrats

markers.marker: Aimee' wife is her gun. That's canon now.
Miko wants to unite kingdoms through political marriages.
Prince Shoutoku was a political leader during Japan's Asuka Period.
Telling Palutena she won't worship her.
Response to Bernie's resposonse to Miko's desires prompt marker.
The Bunbunmaru is Gensokyo's "Alternative Facts" newspaper.
Clownpiece is a Hell Fairy. She dresses like the American flag and is the hardest boss in the game.
"People were confused that I was a trap. I got a vajayjay, guys."
"It turns out the Crown Prince Shoutoku was a girl the whole time. This is some Fate shit, I tell you what."
"Anyway there's differing interpretations of how I ended up as a girl in Gensokyo, but Mister Solitiare went with the 'She's The Man' approach."
"Technically I was never the emperor, just the regent for my Aunt."
"My marriage to Tojiko no Iratsume is a matter of historical record. The yuri sex can be extrapolated from that."
"Also Official Touhou Backstory is that Futo was a brilliant conniver, which is funny because that goes against both her fanon and canon characterization."
"My friend is one of like only two actually evil characters in all of Touhou. The other is a tree."
"Anyway back to the topic at hand. So you thought cause I was called Crown Prince, I got a dick."
"Everyone just calls me Crown Prince. That's it. That's the whole story."
"It would be too weird and OOC for me to be referred to as a princess. And trust me, Touhou has no shortage of Princesses."
"Seriously, Seiga went full Grinch. That's actually canon."
Everyone in Gensokyo can fly. Including Miko. If she wants.
Eientei is home to the Hourai Pharmacist, Eirin Yagokoro, and has a hallway that is infinitely long due to spacetime magic.
Miko claims she invented Japan. She's not wrong.
Inaba of the Earth and Inaba of the Moon
Touhou is full of Jojo references. Miko is no exception.
Miko's responce to Jura's "seduction" marker, all female ver.
Miko's responce to Jura's "seduction" marker, with Meia ver.
Shima was successfully lewded so that Miko may survive.
Miko's "daughter" is Hata no Kokoro, a collection of masks designed by her which eventually turned into a youkai.
Miko senses Kyoko holds a secret.
Miko originated the term "Land of the Rising Sun" to describe Japan in a burn to the Emporer of China.
Shiki is the Goddess of Makai in Touhou. Her maybe daughter Alice lives in the Forest of Magic.
Miko's response to Megumin's "learning more" target.
Miko's response to Megumin's "taoist arts 2" target.
Miko's response to Meia's "Men Info" marker.
Telling the other players to call her "Miko"
Miko thinks people are talking about her.
Everyone in Gensokyo drinks like a fish. Except Byakuren, but screw her.
Yuuka Kazami is the Youkai of Flowers.
Miko thinks Nayru is a mean drunk.
Miko's arch-rival Byakuren is a Buddhist monk with a flying ship full of women. How did I just now realize this connection?
Because Miko can hear everyone's desires, she doesn't need to you to speak aloud. Not that she'd listen if you did.
Miko is only interested in leading the humans of Gensokyo, not the Youkai.
Prompt Marker. Miko, able to read everyone's innermost desires with ease, asks her table-mates to share.
One of several lines Miko can say when taking off her skirt. Miko claims the randomness of the cards interferes with her brilliant strategic mind.
Please don't join a cult Saki.
The Hourai Pharmacist is Eirin Yagokoro, who dabbles in shady new drugs.
Miko wants Rensouhou to pledge their loyalty too.
Miko has unleashed a powerful Special Attack: Spell Card: Human Sign "Tradition of Just Rewards" against Saki.
In Urban Legend in Limbo, Miko tells Nitori after beating her that she doesn't care about money, only speed.
Miko introduces her consort to the crowd.
Tojiko is electrocuting the Crown Prince. Don't worry, she's fine. Tojiko, that is.
One of several lines Miko can say when taking off her skirt. She mentions the fact that undergarments for women were only popularized in Japan within the past 100 years.
Miko is worried about her comerade Yoshika, a Jiang-Shi.
Miko zoned out for a second.
